items: Cut the chicken (breasts or thighs) into cubes and season them.
Cook the chicken in a frying pan over high heat with a spoon of oil.
Cut the onion into thin strips (julienne) and add it to the pan with the thyme. Lower the heat and let the mixture confit for a minimum of 30 minutes.
In a separate pot, prepare the **bechamel sauce**. Melt the butter, cook the flour for a few minutes and add the milk while stirring. Stir until it starts to a boil and thickens.
Chop the whole chicken, onion and thyme together and mix it with the bechamel sauce.
Place the croquette dough in a bowl and cover it with film stuck to the surface (film to skin). Leave it in the fridge for 12-24 h.

description: Now that the base has gained consistency, we can assemble the croquettes.
items: To make the coating, try always to grab the same amount of mixture and make a ball with your hands. We pass this by: flour, beaten egg and breadcrumbs.
When passing it through the breadcrumbs we can choose to leave them spherical or, if we press them lightly, we can make the classic cylindrical shape.
Finally, fry them in abundant sunflower oil until a golden color is achieved.

description: If you prepared croquettes in bulk you can store them for later use. Keep in mind that it is best to keep them in the freezer unstacked and separated so they do not lose their shape. Once they are well frozen, you can group them in a smaller tupper.
